Instrument_Host.name: MINERVA-II1 Rover-1a HIBOU
Instrument_Host.description: MINERVA-II is the second generation of the MINERVA robot installed on the Hayabusa spacecraft, consisting of two containers: MINERVA-II1 and MINERVA-II2. MINERVA-II1 contains two rovers, HIBOU (Highly Intelligent Bouncing Observation Unit) and OWL (Observation unit with intelligent Wheel Locomotion), designed to explore the asteroid Ryugu by hopping on its low-gravity surface. The hopping mechanism uses a motor to rotate a swing-arm, allowing for autonomous movement. HIBOU is equipped with solar cells, communication antennas, wide-angle and stereo cameras, temperature and optical sensors, an accelerometer, and a gyroscope. Its design makes it more sensitive to sunlight compared to OWL, which has fewer solar cells on its surface.
